00022 #ifndef planner_h
00023 #define planner_h
00024 
00025 #include <inttypes.h>
00026 
00027 // This struct is used when buffering the setup for each linear movement "nominal" values are as specified in
00028 // the source g-code and may never actually be reached if acceleration management is active.
00029 typedef struct {
00030 
00031   // Fields used by the bresenham algorithm for tracing the line
00032   uint8_t  direction_bits;            // The direction bit set for this block (refers to *_DIRECTION_BIT in config.h)
00033   uint32_t steps_x, steps_y, steps_z,
00034            steps_t;                   // Step count along each axis
00035 /// 843 : int32_t -> uint32_t  ???
00036   //int32_t  step_event_count;          // The number of step events required to complete this block
00037   uint32_t  step_event_count;          // The number of step events required to complete this bloc
00038 /// <--
00039   // Fields used by the motion planner to manage acceleration
00040   double nominal_speed;               // The nominal speed for this block in mm/min
00041   double entry_speed;                 // Entry speed at previous-current block junction in mm/min
00042   double max_entry_speed;             // Maximum allowable junction entry speed in mm/min
00043   double millimeters;                 // The total travel of this block in mm
00044   uint8_t recalculate_flag;           // Planner flag to recalculate trapezoids on entry junction
00045   uint8_t nominal_length_flag;        // Planner flag for nominal speed always reached
00046 
00047   // Settings for the trapezoid generator
00048   uint32_t initial_rate;              // The step rate at start of block
00049   uint32_t final_rate;                // The step rate at end of block
00050   int32_t rate_delta;                 // The steps/minute to add or subtract when changing speed (must be positive)
00051   uint32_t accelerate_until;          // The index of the step event on which to stop acceleration
00052   uint32_t decelerate_after;          // The index of the step event on which to start decelerating
00053   uint32_t nominal_rate;              // The nominal step rate for this block in step_events/minute
00054 
00055 } block_t;
00056 
00057 // Initialize the motion plan subsystem
00058 void plan_init();
00059 
00060 // Add a new linear movement to the buffer. x, y and z is the signed, absolute target position in
00061 // millimaters. Feed rate specifies the speed of the motion. If feed rate is inverted, the feed
00062 // rate is taken to mean "frequency" and would complete the operation in 1/feed_rate minutes.
00063 void plan_buffer_line(double x, double y, double z, double a, double feed_rate, uint8_t invert_feed_rate);
00064 
00065 // Called when the current block is no longer needed. Discards the block and makes the memory
00066 // availible for new blocks.
00067 void plan_discard_current_block();
00068 
00069 // Gets the current block. Returns NULL if buffer empty
00070 block_t *plan_get_current_block();
00071 
00072 // Reset the planner position vector (in steps)
00073 void plan_set_current_position(int32_t x, int32_t y, int32_t z, int32_t a);
00074 
00075 // Clear the planner position vector
00076 void plan_clear_position();
00077 
00078 // Reinitialize plan with a partially completed block
00079 void plan_cycle_reinitialize(int32_t step_events_remaining);
00080 
00081 // Reset buffer
00082 void plan_reset_buffer();
00083 
00084 // Returns the status of the block ring buffer. True, if buffer is full.
00085 uint8_t plan_check_full_buffer();
00086 
00087 // Block until all buffered steps are executed
00088 void plan_synchronize();
00089 
00090 #endif
